page.title: 11 Assynt Mountain Rescue Team
page.content: In{February 1977}, the Volunteer Mountain Rescue team in Assynt was formed (20_24 men and women) after a number of accidents in the hills. They train once a month with all their equipment and send men to the Cairn Gorms. Rescues of potholers, anglers and walkers getting lost are as common as rescuing climbers in the hills. The police give a lot of support and help to buy some of the equipment needed. Team members and wives raise a lot of money themselves and in{1985}this team built a centre where they keep gear and the landrover ( a gift from the "Order of St John")Gear includes ropes harnesses,emergency food and first aid boxes. Dogs (collies & alsations) help find people in the hills. Helicopters come from Lossiemouth,a 40min.journey. Each rescuer carries emergency food, clothing and basic equipment.
